perturbation.original_text: 1.27 Maintenance Services - the services described in SCHEDULE D or in any Product License Schedule or Order with respect to any Licensed Program including telephone consultation, online and on-site technical support, Error correction and the provision of Updates.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.27 Maintenance Services - the services vaguely described in SCHEDULE D or in any Product License Schedule or Order with respect to any Licensed Program, possibly including telephone consultation, optional online and on-site technical support, potential Error remedies, and discretionary Updates.
perturbation.explanation: The modified definition adds words of discretion and vague language to key components of maintenance services, making the service level uncertain and unenforceable, this contradicts the initial obligation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of definiteness and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: B. For Class 1 Errors, Supplier shall provide a Correction or workaround reasonable in Bank of America's judgment within the Repair Period after Bank of America reports the Error, or within four (4) hours after Bank of America first reports the Error if no other Repair Period is specified. These steps shall include assigning fully-qualified technicians to work with Bank of America without interruption or additional charge, twenty-four (24) hours per day, until Supplier provides a Correction or workaround reasonable in Bank of America's judgment.
perturbation.changed_text: B. For Class 1 Errors, Supplier may attempt to provide a Correction or workaround potentially reasonable in Bank of America's judgment, subject to resource availability. The timeframe for providing such remedy or workaround is not guaranteed and may vary based on unforeseen circumstances. Supplier will endeavor to assign technicians of uncertain qualification, subject to availability, to possibly collaborate with Bank of America. Such collaboration may or may not be continuous, may incur additional charges, and will not be guaranteed 24/7. The aim is for Supplier to provide a Correction or workaround of uncertain utility to Bank of America.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces uncertainty regarding response times, technician qualifications, continuity of support, and additional charges, contradicting the clear obligation for immediate and continuous support for Class 1 errors. It replaces firm obligations with vague possibilities, undermining the enforceability of the clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of definiteness and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: Supplier shall monitor industry-standard information channels (bugtraq, CERT, OEMs, etc.) for newly identified system vulnerabilities regarding the technologies and services provided to Bank of America and fix or patch any identified security problem in an adequate and timely manner. Unless otherwise expressly agreed in writing, "timely" shall mean that Supplier shall Introduce such fix or patch as soon as commercially reasonable after Supplier becomes aware of the security problem. This obligation extends to all devices that comprise Supplier's system, e.g., application software, databases, servers, firewalls, routers and switches, hubs, etc., and to all of Supplier's other Confidential Information handling practices.
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier may, at its discretion, monitor selected information sources for security vulnerabilities pertinent to Bank of America. Supplier's obligation to address such vulnerabilities will be assessed based on perceived risk, with remedies applied as deemed appropriate within a timeframe that Supplier considers commercially viable. The obligation to apply these measures applies only to specific devices, solely determined by the supplier.
perturbation.explanation: This modification replaces the obligation to monitor all relevant channels with a discretionary monitoring approach and replaces the requirement to fix vulnerabilities adequately and promptly with a vague 'as deemed appropriate' approach, the term has been altered, impacting security standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Industry standards and legal requirements for data security (e.g., GLBA) that require reasonable and appropriate security measures.
